title: The Daleks' Master Plan
dialogue_triumphs: Asked if he is English, the Doctor replies: 'Your ideas are too narrow, too crippled. I am a citizen of the Universe, and a gentleman to boot.'
dialogue_disasters: 'Are these tablets?' 'Do you think they're lollipops?'
'Get me out of this place, it's full of Arabs!'
'And a Merry Christmas to all of you at home.'
goofs: Marc Cory's tape message is different from the one he left in 'Mission to the Unknown'.
If the Grand Alliance is so expendable, why have it in the first place?
The Doctor gums during cellular dissemination.
A police box would look very out of place outside a police station.

continuity_notes.name: Mavic Chen
continuity_notes.description: Guardian of the Solar System, member of the Daleks' alliance

continuity_notes.name: The Monk
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord known to the Doctor, aware of the Daleks by reputation
continuity_notes.current_status: TARDIS disabled by the Doctor, can only wander randomly

continuity_notes.name: Taranium
continuity_notes.description: Mineral only found on Uranus, core component of the Time Destructor

continuity_notes.name: Visians
continuity_notes.description: Indigenous population of Mira, invisible, eight feet tall and extremely vicious

technobabble: The Doctor places Bret Vyon in a force field that works on an 'electromagnetic principle'
The Doctor, Steven and Sara become trapped in a cellular disseminator.
The Daleks use a 'randomiser' and a 'magnetise beam' to try to stop the various escape ships the Doctor uses.
links: The Doctor says that the way to defeat the Daleks is 'to look back in the history of the year 2157'
The Monk says that he was able to bypass the dimensional control that the Doctor sabotaged in 'The Time Meddler'.
Cassandra prophesied about Katarina's death in 'The Myth Makers'.

locations.name: Kembel
locations.description: Planet where the Daleks' alliance holds meetings

future_history: Chen states that there has been continuous peace in the solar system since 3975. Earth is developing long-distance teleportation technology. Earth has a class system, a concept of luxury, broadcast news, penal colonies, and a place called Central City. The Technix are all bald. Bret Vyon was raised on Mars Colony 16.
untold_adventures: The Doctor comments that he saw the relief of Mafeking in the Boer War [1900].
qv: Dating the Segments of Time, 'The Ark'
additional_notes: The seventh episode is a mixture of Z Cars, silent Hollywood movies and 1930s serials. During the Hollywood sequence, the Doctor meets Bing Crosby.
bottom_line: An epic story, though one with a plot that was worthy of six episodes at most. Nevertheless, it seems that the story's ambition was justified, despite the seventh episode being a pantomime for Christmas day. A television episode about a television series, the Doctor's acknowledgement of the 'fourth wall' at the climax was 20 years ahead of its time.
